00002 #ifndef __TLM_PEQ_H__
00003 #define __TLM_PEQ_H__
00004 
00005 #include <map>
00006 #include "tlm_h/tlm_analysis/tlm_analysis_if.h"
00007 #include "tlm_h/tlm_analysis/tlm_analysis_port.h"
00008 
00009 namespace tlm {
00010 
00011 //
00012 // No lt_sc_time operator required, since we have operator< defined for
00013 // sc_time ?
00014 //
00015 // struct lt_sc_time {
00016 //  bool operator<( const sc_core::sc_time &a , const sc_core::sc_time &b ) {
00017 //    return a < b;
00018 //  }
00019 // };
00020 //
00021 //
00022 //
00023 
00024 //
00025 // This peq implements a delayed write and has an analysis port
00026 //
00027 // If you post many transactions to the same time slot, this will result in
00028 // many transactions coming out of the analysis port in a single delta
00029 //
00030 // If you want event driven semantics, stuff the output of the analysis port
00031 // into an analysis fifo ( if you want to guarantee no losses ) or
00032 // analysis buffer ( if you don't mind losses but you can't be bothered or are
00033 // not able to clear the fifo out ).
00034 //
00035 // For example, you can arrive at a blocking get interface by doing get on
00036 // an analysis fifo attached to the analysis port shown below
00037 //
00038 // We could even design a tlm_peq_fifo and/or tlm_peq_buffer with these
00039 // channels built in
00040 //
00041 
00042 template< typename T>
00043 class tlm_peq :
00044   public sc_core::sc_module ,
00045   public virtual tlm_delayed_analysis_if< T >
00046 {
00047  public:
00048   sc_core::sc_export< tlm_delayed_analysis_if< T > > delayed_analysis_export;
00049   tlm_analysis_port< T > ap;
00050 
00051   SC_HAS_PROCESS( tlm_peq );
00052 
00053   tlm_peq( sc_core::sc_module_name nm ) : sc_core::sc_module( nm ) , ap("ap") {
00054 
00055     delayed_analysis_export( *this );
00056 
00057     SC_METHOD( wake_up_method );
00058     dont_initialize();
00059     sensitive << m_wake_up;
00060 
00061   }
00062 
00063   int size() const { return m_map.size(); }
00064 
00065   int posted_before( const sc_core::sc_time &time ) const {
00066 
00067     int i = 0;
00068 
00069     for( typename std::multimap< sc_core::sc_time , T>::const_iterator iter = m_map.begin();
00070          iter != m_map.end();
00071          ++iter ) {
00072 
00073       if( (*iter).first < time ) {
00074         i++;
00075       }
00076 
00077     }
00078 
00079     return i;
00080 
00081   }
00082 
00083   int posted_at( const sc_core::sc_time &time ) const {
00084     return m_map.count( time );
00085   }
00086 
00087   void write( const T &transaction , const sc_core::sc_time &time ) {
00088 
00089     m_map.insert( pair_type( time + sc_core::sc_time_stamp() , transaction ) );
00090     m_wake_up.notify( time );
00091 
00092   }
00093 
00094  private:
00095   typedef std::pair<sc_core::sc_time,T> pair_type;
00096 
00097   void wake_up_method() {
00098 
00099     pair_type p;
00100     sc_core::sc_time now = sc_core::sc_time_stamp();
00101 
00102     // must be something there, and it must be scheduled for now
00103 
00104     assert( m_map.size() > 0 );
00105     assert( (*(m_map.begin())).first == now );
00106 
00107     for( p = *(m_map.begin());
00108          p.first == now;
00109          p = *(m_map.begin()) )
00110     {
00111 
00112       ap.write( p.second );
00113       m_map.erase( m_map.begin() );
00114 
00115       if( m_map.size() == 0 ) {
00116         return;
00117       }
00118 
00119       p = *(m_map.begin());
00120 
00121     }
00122 
00123     m_wake_up.notify( p.first - now );
00124 
00125   }
00126 
00127   sc_core::sc_event m_wake_up;
00128   std::multimap< sc_core::sc_time , T> m_map;
00129 
00130 };
00131 
00132 } // namespace tlm
00133 
00134 #endif
